posts.name: Satish Chandra Chitrapu
posts.cooked:
I am unable to download the relevant Apache file. While downloading it from the given Google Drive link, the file has the correct name. After the download the name automatically changes to data, and the upon inspection I see that the format is of a unix executable file, and not a gzipped file. Further, it is ASCII text form with 500 odd very long lines while it supposed to have 258,074 rows according to Graded Assignment Week 3. I’m unable to process it as required.

I’m using a Mac, and don’t have access to another device right now. In case, the OS is the issue.

Please help!

P.S. I tried re-naming the file to the original name given in GDrive and changing the extension to .gz, but it didn’t work. Checking the file type on terminal just tells me it is not a .gz file but an ASCII file

@carlton

posts.name: Rishit Pant
posts.cooked:
You can run this on google colab.

!curl --location --continue-at - --output s-anand.net-May-2024.gz "https://drive.usercontent.google.com/u/0/uc?id=1xLx-odohCtdPYbpOTui23upsCSzMBlpN&export=download"

(Not sure if everybody’s assignment file is different, change the link accordingly.)

posts.name: Satish Chandra Chitrapu
posts.cooked:
Thank you! I used the curl command to upload it to google collab. It uploads fine. But, I get this error:

BadGzipFile: Not a gzipped file (b'<!')

When I run this:

file_path = '/content/s-anand.net-May-2024.gz'

Leap of logic: I think the problem lies with the Apache file.

posts.name: Parameswaran Srivathsan
posts.cooked: why is it that when i try to decompress the file it says the file is not in the gzip format

posts.name: Carlton D'Silva
posts.cooked:
Hi Satish,

Q1 to Q8, of GA3 all have the same file. It does not matter which OS you use (I use all 3).
Click on the link provided, it will get you to this page, click on the download button:

Screenshot 2024-10-13 at 12.40.111082×239 15 KB

Then you should get a file like this:

Screenshot 2024-10-13 at 12.43.181222×136 23.8 KB

And in Mac OS if you double click it, the file will automatically get extracted and you will get the resulting file as seen in the screen shot above.

The file name in the title of your post is wrong btw.
It should be s-anand.net-May-2024

Then you are able to easily process the file using your favourite package. (Note, the file is not a csv)

The above screenshots were all using Mac OS and the chrome browser.

Regards

posts.name: Rishit Pant
posts.cooked: You get redirected to this link when you click download icon in google drive, from there.

posts.name: Satish Chandra Chitrapu
posts.cooked:
Thank you for the response. I tried this but it didn’t work for me. It directly downloads as a filed called “data” with no extension.

However, manually renaming it with .txt worked. And on Google Colab this code worked:

!pip install gdown

!gdown --id 1xLx-odohCtdPYbpOTui23upsCSzMBlpN

import os
import gzip
import shutil

with gzip.open('s-anand.net-May-2024.gz', 'rb') as f_in:
    with open('data', 'wb') as f_out:
        shutil.copyfileobj(f_in, f_out)

os.rename('data', 'data.txt')
